name: List.Extra

values.name: andMap
values.comment:
Map functions taking multiple arguments over multiple lists. Each list should be of the same length.

    ( (\a b c -> a + b * c)
        `map` [1,2,3]
        `andMap` [4,5,6]
        `andMap` [2,1,1]
    ) == [9,7,9]
values.type: List (a -> b) -> List a -> List b

values.name: dropWhile
values.comment: Drop elements in order as long as the predicate evaluates to `True`

values.name: find
values.comment:
Find the first element that satisfies a predicate and return
Just that element. If none match, return Nothing.

    find (\num -> num > 5) [2, 4, 6, 8] == Just 6

values.name: maximumBy
values.comment: Find the first maximum element in a list using a comparable transformation

values.name: minimumBy
values.comment: Find the first minimum element in a list using a comparable transformation

values.name: takeWhile
values.comment: Take elements in order as long as the predicate evaluates to `True`

values.name: zip
values.comment: Take two lists and returns a list of corresponding pairs
values.type: List a -> List b -> List ( a, b )

values.name: zip3
values.comment: Take three lists and returns a list of triples
values.type: List a -> List b -> List c -> List ( a, b, c )

values.name: zip4
values.comment: Take four lists and returns a list of quadruples
values.type: List a -> List b -> List c -> List d -> List ( a, b, c, d )

values.name: zip5
values.comment: Take five lists and returns a list of quintuples
values.type: List a -> List b -> List c -> List d -> List e -> List ( a, b, c, d, e )
